appDescription: Volley Insights is your comprehensive tool for volleyball match analysis. Record games, track player performance, and gain valuable insights to improve your team's strategy.
newGameDescription: Record a new match with real-time event tracking and advanced statistics.
manageTeamDescription: Update your roster, add players, and manage team information.

appPurpose: Whether you're coaching a professional team or leading an amateur club, Volley Insights provides the tools you need to gain a competitive edge and elevate your game strategy.
videoTutorialDescription: Get up to speed with Volley Insights in just a few minutes. Our comprehensive video tutorial walks you through all the key features and functionalities.
realTimeTrackingDescription: Record game events as they happen with our intuitive interface.
advancedAnalyticsDescription: Gain deep insights with our comprehensive performance analysis tools.
rotationManagementDescription: Easily manage and track player rotations throughout the game.
teamProfilesDescription: Create and customize detailed profiles for your teams and players.
dataExportDescription: Share and analyze your game data with easy export options.
mobileFriendlyDescription: Access Volley Insights on any device with our responsive design.
salahDescription: Creator and lead developer of Volley Insights, passionate about volleyball and data analysis.
benrabehDescription: Guiding the research and development process with expertise in sports science and data analytics.
bennadjaDescription: Supporting the project with specialized knowledge in volleyball tactics and performance analysis.
eventRecordingGuideDescription: Learn how to accurately record game events for optimal analysis.
statisticsGuideDescription: Understand the various statistics provided by Volley Insights and how to interpret them.
gameNameRequired: Game name is required and must be at least 3 characters long
errorCreatingGame: An error occurred while creating the game. Please try again.
shirtNumberRequired: Shirt number is required and must be at least 1
removePlayerConfirmation: Are you sure you want to remove {name}?
targetPlaceholder: Specify target area on the court
introductionContent: Welcome to the Event Recording Guide for Volley Insights! This guide will help you accurately record volleyball events during a match, ensuring that your statistics are precise and meaningful. Remember, the key to successful event recording is to stay calm and take a moment to process what you've seen before inputting the data.
accessingEventInputContent: During a live game, you'll find the Event Input section on the main game screen. You can choose between Basic and Advanced input methods.
basicInputMethodContent:
1. Select Player: Click on the button corresponding to the player who performed the action. The buttons display the players currently on the court in their rotation positions.
  2. Select Action: Choose from the following actions: serve, receive, set, spike, block, dig. Each action is color-coded for easy identification.
  3. Select Result: Choose the outcome: point, error, or continue. The result buttons are color-coded: green for point, red for error, and orange for continue.
advancedInputMethodContent:
In the advanced input, you'll have dropdown menus for more detailed event recording:

  • Player: Select the player who performed the action.
  • Action: Choose from serve, receive, set, spike, block, dig.
  • Type: Specifies the type of action (e.g., float serve, jump serve).
  • Evaluation: Rate the quality of the action (e.g., perfect, good, OK, poor).
  • Result: Indicate the outcome (point, error, continue).
  • Target: For certain actions, specify the target area on the court.
recordingSpecificEventsContent:
Attacks

Definition: A strategic hit by a player with the intent of scoring a point.

When to record: Any time a player attempts to score with an aggressive hit.

How to record:

  1. Select the attacking player.
  2. Choose "spike" as the action.
  3. In advanced mode, select the type of attack (e.g., power, off-speed, tip).
  4. Choose the result:
    • Point: If the attack directly leads to a point (kill).
    • Error: If the attack results in a point for the opposing team.
    • Continue: If the ball stays in play.
  5. In advanced mode, evaluate the quality of the attack and specify the target area.
tipsForAccurateRecording: Tips for Accurate and Fast Event Recording
tipsForAccurateRecordingContent:
• Familiarize yourself with the interface: Practice using both the basic and advanced input methods before an actual game.
  • Use the basic input method for speed: For most plays, the 3-step process (select player, action, result) is fastest. Only use advanced input when you need to capture more detailed information.
  • Stay focused on the game: Watch each play carefully and process what you've seen before inputting. Don't get distracted by the app - keep your eyes on the court.
  • Use the color-coding to your advantage: Player buttons, action types, and results are color-coded for quick identification. Train your eye to recognize these colors for faster input.
  • Record events immediately: Input each event as soon as the play ends. Don't wait to record multiple events at once, as this can lead to errors.
teamStatsContent:
These statistics provide an overview of the team's overall performance:

  • Total Points: The total number of points your team has scored. A basic but fundamental indicator of success.
  • Total Errors: The total number of errors your team has made. Minimizing errors is crucial for consistent performance.
  • Serve Efficiency: (Points + Continues - Errors) / Total Serve Attempts. Measures how effective your team's serves are in generating points or putting pressure on the opponent.
  • Attack Efficiency: (Kills - Errors) / Total Attack Attempts. The most important offensive statistic in volleyball. Measures how effectively your team converts attacks into points.
  • Block Efficiency: (Points + Continues - Errors) / Total Block Attempts. Measures the effectiveness of your team's blocking at the net.
  • Side Out Percentage: (Points Scored When Receiving) / (Total Times Receiving). Reflects your team's ability to side out (win a point) when the opponent is serving.
  • Break Point Percentage: (Points Scored When Serving) / (Total Times Serving). Measures your team's ability to score points when they are serving.
  • Rotation Effectiveness (Receive-Block-Attack): Calculated for each unique player rotation on the court. Provides three percentages: Receive Effectiveness, Block Effectiveness, and Attack Effectiveness.
individualPlayerBasicStatsContent:
These statistics track individual player performance across different skills:

Serve

  • Total Attempts: Number of serves taken.
  • Points: Number of aces (serves directly resulting in a point).
  • Errors: Number of service faults.
  • Efficiency: (Points - Errors) / Total Serve Attempts

Reception

  • Total Attempts: Number of receptions taken.
  • Points: Number of receptions directly resulting in a point.
  • Errors: Number of reception errors.
  • Efficiency: (Continues + Points) / Total Reception Attempts

Set

  • Total Attempts: Number of sets made.
  • Points: Number of sets directly resulting in a point.
  • Errors: Number of setting errors.
  • Efficiency: (Continues + Points - Errors) / Total Set Attempts

Attack

  • Total Attempts: Number of attacks made.
  • Points (Kills): Number of successful attacks resulting in points.
  • Errors: Number of attack errors.
  • Efficiency: (Kills - Errors) / Total Attack Attempts

Block

  • Total Attempts: Number of block attempts.
  • Points: Number of blocks directly resulting in points.
  • Errors: Number of block errors.
  • Efficiency: (Points + Continues - Errors) / Total Block Attempts

Dig

  • Total Attempts: Number of digs attempted.
  • Valid Attempts (Continues): Number of digs that kept the ball in play.
  • Errors: Number of digging errors (rare).
individualPlayerAdvancedStatsContent:
These statistics provide a more detailed and nuanced understanding of player performance:

Serve

  • Ace Serve Percentage: (Points - Errors) / Total Attempts * 100
  • Valid Serve Percentage: (Perfect + Good - Errors) / Total Attempts * 100
  • Points per Serve Type: Breakdown of points scored by each serve type (Float, Jump, Topspin).
  • Points per Serve Target: For each zone: (Points Scored in Zone) / (Attempts to Zone) * 100

Reception

  • Valid Reception Percentage: (Perfect + Good - Errors) / Total Attempts * 100

Set

  • Successful Set Percentage: (Perfect + Good) / Total Attempts * 100
  • Set Target Distribution: Breakdown of sets to each target player or zone.

Attack

  • Kill Percentage: (Kills - Errors) / Total Attempts * 100
  • Valid Attack Percentage: (Perfect + Good - Errors) / Total Attempts * 100
  • Points per Attack Type: Breakdown of points scored by each attack type (Power, Off-speed, Tip).
  • Points per Attack Target: For each zone: (Points Scored in Zone) / (Attempts to Zone) * 100
chartTypesAndInterpretationContent:
Bar Charts

Purpose: Bar charts are used to compare different categories of data using rectangular bars. The height of each bar represents the value of the corresponding category.

Use in Volley Insights: You can use bar charts to visualize:

  • Individual player stats for different actions (e.g., points, errors, efficiency for serving, attacking, etc.).
  • Team stats for different skills (e.g., serve efficiency, attack efficiency, etc.).
  • Rotation effectiveness for each rotation, showing the effectiveness for receive, block, and attack side-by-side.

Interpretation:

  • Longer bars represent higher values.
  • You can easily compare the performance of different players or the team's effectiveness in different skills by looking at the relative heights of the bars.

Pie Charts

Purpose: Pie charts are used to show the proportion of different parts of a whole. Each slice of the pie represents a category, and the size of the slice is proportional to its value.

Use in Volley Insights: You can use pie charts to visualize:

  • Distribution of points scored by different actions (e.g., kills, blocks, aces).
  • Set target distribution for a setter, showing the percentage of sets to different attackers or zones.
  • Points per serve type or attack type, showing the proportion of points scored from each type.

Interpretation:

  • Larger slices represent a greater proportion of the whole.
  • You can quickly see which categories dominate or contribute the most.

Benefits of Using Charts

  • Easy to Understand: Charts make it easy to grasp complex data at a glance.
  • Visually Appealing: Charts are more engaging and visually interesting than just looking at tables of numbers.
  • Identify Trends: Charts can help you identify patterns and trends in the data, such as which player is consistently scoring the most points or which rotation has the highest attack effectiveness.
